image.altText: packaging of huon salmon

props.synopsis: RSPCA Australia has withdrawn its certification from salmon farming giant Huon Aquaculture following the release of a video that shows live fish being dumped into bins.

title.children: Huon salmon stripped of RSPCA approval after video scandal

image.altText: An older man with glasses leans on a post while wearing a life jacket. He speaks to another man in a blue shirt.

props.synopsis: Federal Labor will push through legislation next week which could derail a legal battle over salmon farming's impact on an endangered ray and safeguard the industry's future in Tasmania.

title.children: Federal Labor's move to protect Macquarie Harbour salmon farming blasted by Greens

image.altText: A dog is silhouetted running alongside a side-by-side in a picturesque landscape with green trees and rolling hills.

props.synopsis: Newly released safety statistics show side-by-side vehicles were involved in 14 deaths on Australian farms in 2024 despite being fitted with seatbelts and rollover protection cages.

title.children: Vehicle touted as safer than quad bikes now leading killer on farms

image.altText: A man with medium-length hair wearing a blue t-shirt smiles while sitting on a couch.

props.synopsis: A man accused of a violent murder has said he went to the dead man's rural Tasmanian property with plans to steal an AK-47 assault rifle for protection, as he was being threatened by drug dealers.

title.children: Plan to steal AK-47 rifle was for protection against drug dealers, court told

image.altText: A couple stand behind a flock of brown hens, with green grass and clouds in the sky.

props.synopsis: After 12 months of empty egg shelves in supermarkets, thousands of people across Australia are looking for ways around the shortages.

title.children: Thousands of backyards turn into homegrown chook farms amid egg shortage

image.altText: Tassie Devils unveil their new mascot, Rum'un 2025-03-18 11:03:00

props.synopsis: He's a little ugly and rough as guts. Perfectly imperfect, laughed at and misunderstood by those across the strait. And what could be more Tasmanian than that? Meet Rum'un, the Devils' new mascot.

title.children: Who, or what, is Rum'un, Tasmania's new AFL mascot?

image.altText: Blue and white police tape in front of traffic accident scene

props.synopsis: An anonymous Tasmanian tipster is eligible for a reward of up to $2,000 for information they gave to Crime Stoppers, but they can't be tracked down due to the secretive nature of the organisation's model.

title.children: Secretive nature of Crime Stoppers tip line means reward unclaimed

image.altText: Logged trees in a pile in a forest.

props.synopsis: The state government has identified five parcels of land for logging, but redacted their location. It has left some Tasmanians "shocked that in 2025 that we're actually having to fight for our native forests".

title.children: Nearly 10,000ha undisclosed forest set for logging, sleuthing shows us where

image.altText: Cadbury factory in Claremont, Hobart

props.synopsis: A growing "effluent plume" near Hobart's Museum of Old and New Art (Mona) was far from ideal a week before Christmas. Emails and reports show how the environmental emergency at a nearby Cadbury factory developed.

title.children: How Cadbury factory caused a 'muddy water' environmental emergency

image.altText: People wearing masks looking sad on a red bus in London

props.synopsis: The top 10 happiest countries have been announced, with some nations ranking for the first time.

title.children: Australia no longer one of the world's top 10 happiest countries

image.altText: The founders of Ben and Jerry's holding a tub of Ice Cream

props.synopsis: The ice cream maker has once again clashed with its parent company Unilever over its stance on Gaza, claiming its CEO was unlawfully dismissed.

title.children: Ben & Jerry's says its CEO was sacked for activism. How did we get here?

image.altText: A pair of stained shorts with multiple holes.

props.synopsis: Female prisoners in a safety unit are subjected to degrading conditions, with menstrual blood seen on women, beds and cells, a new report says.

title.children: Prisoners hold pads between their legs in 'degrading' treatment

image.altText: Dutton lowy institute

props.synopsis: The opposition leader has also escalated his criticism of China and taken aim at the prime minister's willingness to send peacekeeping troops to Ukraine in a major foreign policy speech at the Lowy Institute.

title.children: Dutton confident he can find 'common ground' with Trump

image.altText: Black badges on an olive green backdrop with the words 'It's not over yet search on MH370' with an image of a plane

props.synopsis: A US-based marine robotics company will be paid $110.2 million if it locates the flight's wreckage in a new 15,000-square-kilometre site in the southern Indian Ocean

title.children: New Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 search approved by government

image.altText: A man wearing a khaki fleece is handcuffed behind his back. A man in a blue tee holds his arm

props.synopsis: The Trump administration has drawn pushback for attempting to deport a permanent resident under an obscure and untested Cold War-era statute. Here's what to know.

title.children: Whisked away and facing deportation, this man could become a thorn in Trump's side

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is trading higher despite a surprise fall in employment of nearly 53,000 people. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Market betting on a May rate cut, with little impact from jobs data

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Unemployment would have surged to 4.7 per cent without participation slump
70 per cent of market betting on a rate cut in May
Population growth continues slowing in September quarter

image.altText: protestors in a creek stand off in front of armed police officers

props.synopsis: Greenpeace must pay substantial damages for defamation and other claims brought by a oil pipeline company over the Standing Rock protests in 2016 and 2017.

title.children: Greenpeace must pay $1 billion in damages, could go bankrupt

image.altText: A smiling woman wearing a yellow top stands in front of a field of yellow flowers

props.synopsis: A mother charged with the attempted murder of her two sons after stabbing them multiple times on an Adelaide motorway has been found not guilty by way of mental incompetence.

title.children: Adelaide mother who stabbed her two sons found not guilty by way of mental incompetence

image.altText: A young Israeli man with dark hair and wearing a green shirt standing among protesters in a street.

props.synopsis: The Israeli prime minister is facing fierce protests over his decision to launch fresh strikes in Gaza, shattering the ceasefire in the strip.

title.children: Thousands march on Netanyahu's home after latest Gaza strikes

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Cars in water

props.synopsis: With already nine tropical cyclones developing since December, and one potentially forming this week, Australia's busiest cyclone season in 19 years could be on the cards.

title.children: The next Australian cyclone could be less than a week away

image.altText: A small bowl of plain elbow pasta next to a red squeeze bottle.

props.synopsis: Parents say they are being lied to about the quality of food at childcare centres across the country. Some say they were promised in-house chefs but children were served "two-minute noodles".

title.children: 'We don't actually serve that': Parents lied to about childcare food standards

image.altText: Students walking at the University of Notre Dame Fremantle campus

props.synopsis: A cyber attack on Perth's Notre Dame University IT systems nine weeks ago is still playing havoc on campus with students reporting uncertainty with graduations, finding classes, and submitting assignments.

title.children: Notre Dame uni students say cyber attack playing havoc with studies

image.altText: A screenshot of a video posted to RedNote shows Peter Dutton and the words "Dutton will not use Aboriginal flag".

props.synopsis: A series of attacks on Australian political parties on emerging Chinese social media platform RedNote raise concerns about misinformation, disinformation and the risk of foreign interference ahead of the federal election.

title.children: A deepfake Dutton speaks Mandarin on Chinese social media platform

image.altText: Dead silver fish lying in the sand among sea weed.

props.synopsis: Thousands of small fish have washed up on beaches all along the NSW south coast and experts don't know why.

title.children: Mystery as thousands of dead juvenile fish wash up on beaches

image.altText: A graphic showing a range of reader comments about potential issues in Australia's 2025 federal election.

props.synopsis: What do you need to know as we head into a budget, just weeks out from a federal election? Have Your Say.

title.children: Have Your Say: What matters to you in this year's pre-election budget?

image.altText: A man stands in front of a white wall in american prison

props.synopsis: Former Adelaide megachurch pastor Daniel Menelaou, who was last week charged in the US with possession of child sexual abuse material, has been banned from working with children in SA.

title.children: Pastor arrested in US for alleged abuse banned from working with children

image.altText: SpaceX dragon capsule entering the earth's atmosphere

props.synopsis: After 268 days without fresh air or a proper shower, Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams made their final journey back to Earth.

title.children: Falling from the stars and greeted by dolphins: How NASA's 'stranded' astronauts came home

image.altText: A man walking in flood water near a stranded car.

props.synopsis: As north Queenslanders cope with the second flood in as many months, frustrations are growing over yet another closure of the Bruce Highway.

title.children: Residents angry over lack of flood warning and third highway closure

image.altText: A photo of Sol overlaid on a photo of a two bathroom stalls - one for women and one for men.

props.synopsis: With universities and sports stadiums installing gender-inclusive bathrooms, Australia is considering making changes to make it easier to do so. We unpack what the proposed changes would mean.

title.children: Australia considering making changes to build all-gender bathrooms

image.altText: Gathering against the CIGEO nuclear waste project in Toulouse 2018

props.synopsis: A series of massive underground tunnels for nuclear waste are under construction across Europe and the UK, but how we will warn future generations of their dangers is still up in the air.

title.children: Nuclear waste remains dangerous for 4.5 billion years. So what do we do with it?

image.altText: A laptop showing the homepage of ChatGPT.

props.synopsis: OpenAI says its latest chatbot should make fewer "hallucination" errors based on a measurement system the company devised. So how does it work, and what does it show?

title.children: 'Flawed from the start': Accuracy of OpenAI's newest GPT questioned

image.altText: A man in a courtyard resting his arms on a broom

props.synopsis: The Real Estate Institute of Australia says tenants are under no legal obligation to hire a professional to tidy their rental garden or courtyard.

title.children: How tidy does your garden need to be at the end of a lease?

image.altText: A close up of a woman smiling.

props.synopsis: A leading hay fever expert says the majority of sufferers don't seek help or know how to treat it properly, but a new trial could change how it's managed.

title.children: Most hay fever sufferers don't get help, or get it wrong, expert says

image.altText: American singer Kashus Culpepper sits in the woods with an acoustic guitar. He wears a headband.

props.synopsis: Navy veteran Kashus Culpepper is one of America's most exciting new singers, with a soulful take on country inspired by life in churches in the American south.

title.children: Stranded during COVID, this Navy soldier set out to become a country star
